qas.question: What was Canada's date for the switch between analog and digital transmission?
What did CBC announce on August 31, 2011?

answers.text: it will not extend its association with any of its private affiliates

qas.question: In March 2011, CBC and CKPR agreed to continue working together for how many additional years?
Who purchased CFTK and CJDC in March 2012?

plausible_answers.text: will not extend its association with any of its private affiliates

qas.question: The CBC cited not wanting to pay for the transition from analog to digital as it's reason for doing this?
The CBC's refusal meant that hundreds of thousands would not have television access after what date?
The CRTC requested that the CBC negotiate with this station in order to extend their contract?
CTV and CTV2 purchased Bell Media in 2012 for what sum?

context: According to filings to the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) by Thunder Bay Electronics (owner of CBC's Thunder Bay affiliate CKPR-DT) and Bell Media (owner of CBC affiliates CFTK-TV in Terrace and CJDC-TV in Dawson Creek),[citation needed] the CBC informed them that <a1_0>it <b4_0>will not extend its association with any of its private affiliates<b4_0/><a1_0/> beyond <a0_0><b5_0>August 31, 2011<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Incidentally, that was also the date for analogue to digital transition in Canada. Given recent practice and the CBC's decision not to convert any retransmitters to digital, even in markets with populations in the hundreds in thousands, it is not expected that the CBC will open new transmitters to replace its affiliates, and indeed may pare back its existing transmitter network. However, in March 2011, <b6_0>CKPR<b6_0/> announced that it had come to a programming agreement with the CBC, in which the station will continue to provide CBC programming in Thunder Bay for a period of <a2_0>five<a2_0/> years. On March 16, 2012, Astral Media announced the sale of its assets to <a3_0>Bell Media<a3_0/>, owners of CTV and CTV Two, for <b7_0>$3.38 billion<b7_0/> with CFTK and CJDC included in the acquisition. Whether the stations will remain CBC affiliates or become owned-and-operated stations of CTV or CTV Two following the completion of the merger is undetermined.
